text: So what I'm really interested in are patterns that don't have a history and they don't have an explanation in terms of physics And what could that possibly be So, so here's one example This thing is called a Halley plot and there's a million examples I just like these It's called a Hali plot You get it It's a fractal that you get from plotting this very simple formula, this tiny little seed in complex number Z If you unpack, it gives you this And if you slowly change one of these numbers, what you'll get are videos and movies of all this kind of stuff
content_summary: The speaker is interested in unexplained patterns, using the example of a Halley plot, a fractal derived from a simple formula involving complex numbers. The speaker notes that changing one of these numbers results in dynamic visual changes.
